name: Computer software use
description: Covers the general use and operational skills of various computer software applications, such as office suites, graphics editing software, and specialized domain-specific software.

name: Computer use
description: Refers to the fundamental skills in using computer hardware and operating systems, including file management, system settings, basic troubleshooting, and understanding computer principles.

name: Internet use
description: The ability to effectively and safely use the internet for information retrieval, communication, online transactions, and social interaction, including browser usage, search engine optimization, and cybersecurity awareness.

name: Use of software for calculating (spreadsheets)
description: Focuses on using spreadsheet software (e.g., Microsoft Excel, Google Sheets) for data calculation, analysis, visualization, and management.

name: Use of software for data processing
description: Involves skills in using various software tools for data collection, cleaning, transformation, analysis, and storage, potentially including database software, statistical analysis software, or ETL tools.
resources: https://www.python.org/ (for data science libraries like Pandas, NumPy)

name: Use of software for desktop publishing
description: Refers to using desktop publishing software (e.g., Adobe InDesign, Microsoft Publisher) to create and typeset professional-quality documents such as flyers, brochures, books, and magazines.

name: Use of software for word processing
description: Focuses on using word processing software (e.g., Microsoft Word, Google Docs) to create, edit, format, and manage text documents.
